file_content.text: You've landed on Nar Shaddaa? Few on that world will be pleased to see you, I'm afraid.
Nar Shaddaa is a den of corruption, excess and gang violence. It is ruled by a crime syndicate, the Hutt Cartel, that takes a cut from every black deed.
Nar Shaddaa must have been a lawful place once.
Has it always been like this?
At best it was a refugee camp for the Evocii, the original natives, until the Hutts imposed their heavy industry there.
Surely someone must stand up to this Hutt Cartel.
Nobody stops them?
The Cartel deals badly with those who say "no."
I should look into this corruption--purely for research, of course.
Finally, somewhere exciting.
Many Jedi have thought the same, and either fallen to darkness or run afoul of the Cartel itself.
But now, despite its power, the Hutt Cartel is clashing with a new group called the "Guiding Hand."
The Guiding Hand's followers are fanatically loyal to an unknown leader. I believe this leader is Duras Fain, one of the missing Jedi Masters.
Is there evidence suggesting Master Fain is involved?
Why do you think so?
What was Master Fain's business on Nar Shaddaa?
Why was he here?
He went there hoping to quell the worst of the Cartel's activities. Against my advice.
Blind obedience to a secret leader... if it is Fain, he's got the makings of an army.
It sounds like a cult.
That is my fear.
Fain is an undisciplined maverick, but he has great charisma--incredible skill at influencing others through the Force.
This Guiding Hand has attacked Cartel spice shipments--operations Fain despises--in a way that shouts Fain's tactics. It's him. I know it.
I'll find him, Master. Hopefully he'll be cooperative.
I can stop Fain peacefully.
If he is forcing these people to fight the Hutts, he must be stopped.
He's risking innocent lives.
Fain has flirted with darkness for years--the plague may have finally tipped the balance.
Ill or not, he is right about opposing the Hutt Cartel.
Fain's doing the right thing.
Even fighting the Guiding Hand, the Cartel is immensely powerful, second only to the Republic and the Empire.
So far the Hutt Cartel has tolerated--even aided---the Republic, but if it discovers a rogue Jedi is hurting business....
We'd lose the Cartel's trade routes, information and credits.
It will turn on the Republic.
The Hutts might even strike against the Jedi over this.
The order would be blamed.
My concern is less for the order than for the Republic.
The Republic can manage without scraps from a gangster's table.
We don't need the Hutts!
But what if the Cartel were allied with the Empire instead?
We must find Fain before the Hutt Cartel discovers his involvement. I have a contact on Nar Shaddaa who can help you, named Tharan Cedrax.
Tharan is a professor of exo-technology. He was once a friend of mine, and of Fain's.
That's not a science I'm familiar with.
Exo-technology?
Tharan specializes in technology thought to originate outside the galaxy itself. Fascinating, and quite over my head.
How do I find this "Tharan Cedrax"?
Then I'll speak to him.
If Tharan Cedrax was friends with Fain, he might not be willing to help me.
Tharan could be loyal to Fain.
Being Fain's friend puts him in danger, if the Cartel uncovers the truth about the Guiding Hand. He'll help you.
Tharan has offices on Nar Shaddaa's Promenade. He's usually there... if he's not "nurturing his genius" in a casino.
Good luck. And don't underestimate Duras Fain, Jedi. His gifts of persuasion are unsurpassed.
